All Classes

Class Description
DesperatesDeveloperPerson  
HelpfulNPEMessages
A container for methods showing common cases where NPE happens.
PatternMatchingForInstanceof
The pattern matching for instanceof (JEP 305) feature allows us to test if a reference is an instance of a class and cast it in "one shot" eliminating one line of boilerplate cast.
Person
A simple person (we can get his/her first name, last name and age).
PersonClass
A very verbose and old-fashioned implementation of the Person interface.
Records
Record properties (as per JEP 359): private final field for each component; public read accessor method for each component of the state description, with the same name and type as the component; a public constructor, whose signature is the same as the state description, which initializes each field from the corresponding argument; implementations of equals and hashCode that say two records are equal if they are of the same type and contain the same state; implementation of toString that includes the string representation of all the record components, with their names; cannot extend any other class; cannot declare instance fields other than the private final fields which correspond to components of the state description; any other fields which are declared must be static; implicitly final; cannot be abstract; are shallowly immutable.
SwitchExpressions
In this example set we assume that we are working on a calendar application, following the same thought process as the snippets in JEP 361 (Switch Expressions).
TextBlocks
This class dives into the JEP 368 (Text Blocks) enhancement proposal.

Note that Java 14 sees this JEP as a second preview, so this is not entirely new to Java 14.
WeekDay
Just the days of the week...
